programme.desc: Ivy and creeper aggressively climb up taller plants in order to make it to the sunlight; in the parched desert, the dragon's blood tree uses its funnel-shaped canopy to collect moisture from mist; carnivorous plants capture insects.

programme.title: Life in Color with David Attenborough

programme.title: Life in Color with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough relies on new advances in science and specialized cameras to discover how animals use color in their everyday lives in their natural habitats, including in various oceans and rainforests around the world.

programme.title: Seven Worlds One Planet
programme.desc: An examination of brown bears lurking around remote Russian volcanoes; a look at how yeti-like monkeys survive in China's mountain forests; despite soaring temperatures in Iran, a bizarre predator makes its home in the desert.

programme.title: Earth's Great Seasons
programme.desc: Summer is a time of long days and great abundance, but the rising temperatures don't make life easy for everyone, as sneaky ring-tailed lemurs, battling ibex and color-changing lizards face unique challenges during this time.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: An in-depth look is taken at two widely different, colorful and mysterious landscapes at the southern tip of the continent, which are home to variety of animals and created by two great ocean currents, one warm and one cold.

programme.title: Planet Earth

programme.title: The Blue Planet II
